alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 4:20PM CDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw and Washington. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Silas, Gretna, Denham, Isney, Contwell, Aquilla, Boice, Woodwards, Dunbar, West King, Bolinger and Collumburg. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
